snippet: The ruling by a British judge is the latest twist in a global legal battle over patents between bitter rivals in the smartphone and tablet businesses.
abstract: Eric Pfanner Advertising column observes a British judge has ordered Apple to post notices on its Web site and to take out newspaper ads declaring that Samsung did not infringe Apple design patents; points out the ruling is the latest twist in a global legal battle over patents between bitter rivals in the smartphone and tablet businesses.

headline.main: Judge Tells Apple to Advertise a Win for Samsung
headline.print_headline: Judge Tells Apple to Advertise a Win for Samsung

snippet: Does Mitt Romney wish he’d planted less of his fortune under other countries’ flags?
abstract: Does Mitt Romney wish he’d planted less of his fortune under other countries’ flags?

snippet: The perennially picked on San Fernando Valley may never be considered truly hip. But that’s exactly its charm.

headline.main: Los Angeles? The Valley Is Way Cooler
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles? The Valley Is Way Cooler

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes the trouble with data-sharing plans, a chat with the former Internet analyst Mary Meeker and a history of stra...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes the trouble with data-sharing plans, a chat with the former Internet analyst Mary Meeker and a history of strange assassination attempts. Exploding chocolate, anyone?

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: The Downside of Data-Sharing, Mary Meeker Speaks, and the Chocolate Assassin

snippet: An accounting charge related to Microsoft’s acquisition of an online advertising business led to a rare quarterly loss for the software giant. Revenue from Windows declined.
abstract: Accounting charge related to Microsoft’s acquisition of an online advertising business leads to a rare quarterly loss; fiscal fourth-quarter loss was $492 million, or 6 cents a share, compared with profit of $5.87 billion, or 69 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue was $18.06 billion, up from $17.37 billion.

headline.main: Microsoft Reports Loss After a Write-Down
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Reports Loss After a Write-Down

snippet: The search giant reported an increase in revenue and profit in the second quarter, though ad revenue per click declined and Motorola Mobility lost money.
abstract: Google reports second-quarter profit of $2.79 billion, or $8.42 a share, from $2.51 billion, or $7.68 a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue was $12.21 billion, up 35 percent from $9.03 billion.

headline.main: As Google Changes, Its Revenue Keeps Rising
headline.print_headline: As Google Changes, Its Revenue Keeps Rising

snippet: Cater2.me, a San Francisco office-catering middleman, has branched out to Manhattan, hoping to satisfy the insatiable hunger for new and interesting local food.
abstract: Cater2.me, a San Francisco office-catering middleman, has branched out to Manhattan, hoping to satisfy the insatiable hunger for new and interesting local food.

headline.main: Haute Food in New York, Delivered to Your Desk

snippet: Mark Penn, a former strategic adviser to Bill and Hillary Clinton, will now work for a new boss: Steve Ballmer, the chief executive of Microsoft. The company said that Mr. Penn, 58, will become a corporate vice president at the company for strateg...
abstract: Mark Penn, a former strategic adviser to Bill and Hillary Clinton, will now work for a new boss: Steve Ballmer, the chief executive of Microsoft. The company said that Mr. Penn, 58, will become a corporate vice president at the company for strategic and special projects, leading a "small interdisciplinary team."

snippet: Apple’s voice-recognition product is coy, but appears less capable than a similar recent offering from Google.
abstract: Apple’s voice-recognition product is coy, but appears less capable than a similar recent offering from Google.

headline.main: Google's Data Advantage Over Apple's Siri
